Konnichiwa,

    I know this may be an outlandish request, but I was wondering if anyone who has access to buying those mini kabuto would be willing to buy the whole series for me, and I would pay them back in full. I do not live in Japan, unfortunately, and I have fallen in love with those kabuto. If anyone would be willing to help me out, I would appreciate it very much and be forever in your debt. Thank you for your time.

Compassion go with you,

    ~Sasaki Kojiro~
  ----- Original Message ----- 
  From: sinseism 
  To: samuraihistory@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Thursday, August 01, 2002 1:31 PM
  Subject: [samuraihistory] great collection of miniature kabuto


  Hello group.
  I found a good collectible series of miniature Kabuto(Samurai helmet) 
  at a supermaket today.It is called "Gekisen"series and sold as a 
  candy with a prize.It costs 300yen.very reasonable.I got one and was 
  surprised at its high quality.It has 13 versions including Kato 
  kiyomasa's model and Kuroda Nagamasa's.Unfortunately it seems only 
  available in Japan currently.

  This page introduces the series.
  http://www1.neweb.ne.jp/wb/ks-shop/ksshop_126.htm

  Shinsei
